result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Corddarrel Cavett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Full Huber, Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by November 5 2022  for report date within 60 days or no later than January 1 2022. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.
Concurrent with: 22CM191

records.addlTxt: 8:57 AM Defendant Derrick Corddarrel Cavett in court.  Attorney Shanna Sanders in court for Derrick Corddarrel Cavett.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to count one Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders 45 days Jail with full huber and diversion, defendant to contact diversion by November 5, 2022 and report no later than January 1, 2023. Court costs due January 6, 2023 This sentence is concurrent with 22CM191. 0 days credit. Count two is dismissed and read in. 0 Days Credit

Activity: Initial appearance

10:15 AM Defendant Derrick Corddarrel Cavett in court by video with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $500 with conditions. No contact with B.M.M.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant must sign bond within the next week. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.
Initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
